meanings.definition: The plural form of 'momentum', referring to the quantity of motion of a moving body.
meanings.sent1: The momenta of the speeding car were impressive as it zoomed past.
meanings.sent2: The momenta of the athletes helped them cross the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The momenta of the playful puppies caused chaos in the park.
meanings.sent4: The momenta of the storm clouds gathered ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The momenta of the waterfall cascading down the rocks was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A force or influence that makes an event happen or change.
meanings.sent1: The momenta behind the decision was strong and unwavering.
meanings.sent2: The momenta of public opinion can sway political outcomes.
meanings.sent3: The momenta of the dance party was irresistible, drawing everyone to the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The momenta of technological advancements is shaping our future.
meanings.sent5: The momenta of the protest movement grew stronger with each new supporter.
